bug.author: MellonGuan
bug.summary: Tensorflow Website XSRF Token missing or incorrect
bug.description:
The error occurs when I click develop button in "www.tensorflow.org/programmers_guide/variables" or in everywhere. My default lang is set to English(but it does not matter and has influence only on the bottom menu). But when I'm trying to change the language to Chinese I get the following error message:
XSRF Token missing or incorrect
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19337606/41533342-02b6581e-732d-11e8-95a9-afbe28a40dbe.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19337606/41533370-1cda29dc-732d-11e8-9912-2eb9583feb71.png></denchmark-link>
Windows 10 Version 67.0.3396.87 (Official Build) (64-bit)

comments.comment: Thank you for your post. We noticed you have not filled out the following field in the issue template. Could you update them if they are relevant in your case, or leave them as N/A? Thanks. Have I written custom code OS Platform and Distribution TensorFlow installed from TensorFlow version Bazel version CUDA/cuDNN version GPU model and memory Exact command to reproduce
There are XSRF issues with switching languages if you are signed in with multiple accounts. Is that the case here?

Nagging Assignee <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wolffg>@wolffg</denchmark-link> : It has been 14 days with no activity and this issue has an assignee. Please update the label and/or status accordingly.

Given there's been no followup in two weeks, I'm closing this. We are aware of a bug with XSRF and multi-login, and I assume this is was what happened here. The site eng team is working on it. If it wasn't please reopen or refile. Thanks!
